FacilityName: Delta Pride Catfish, Inc. - Main Plant
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Delta Pride Catfish, Inc. - Main Plant (Delta Pride), Indianola, Mississippi  has anhydrous ammonia on site that requires protection as defined under the Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation. Delta Pride has implemented a PSM program to provide information to employees to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling and processing of highly hazardous materials.  The program emphasizes the application of management controls and standard operating procedures when addressing the risks associated with handling or working near highly hazardous chemicals.

The Ammonia Refrigeration System (the System) for Delta Pride utilizes anhydrous ammonia to function as the heat transfer medium. Anhydrous ammonia is the only highly hazardous chemical above the threshold quantity on-site.  The System contains nine high stage compressors and eight low stage compressors.  The System utilizes liquid ammonia injection for oil cooling on twelve of the compressors and water cooled oil coolers on the remaining five compressors.

The System contains nine evaporative condensers to convert the high pressure ammonia gas into high pressure liquid. After the high pressure ammonia gas is condensed, it is transferred to the high pressure receiver.

The System, which maintains a maximum inventory of 19,700 pounds (lbs.) of anhydrous ammonia, includes three high stage recirculators which provide high temperature liquid ammonia to various evaporator units in the facility.  The System also includes three low stage recirculators which provide low temperature liquid ammonia to other evaporator units throughout the facility.

Ammonia vapor is removed from the low temperature recirculators to the suction of the low stage compressors.  The discharge from the low stage compressors goes to the high stage recirculators, which provide ammonia vapor to the suction of the high stage compressors.  The discharge from the high stage compressors p

rovides high temperature ammonia gas to the evaporative condensers.

The worst-case release and the alternate release scenarios are delineated below.  EPA?s RMP*Comp? was used in the consequence analyses.

Worst Case
Chemical and Amount Released:19,700 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia in 10 minutes inside the Ammonia Room.
Weather Conditions:77 ?F with a 3.4 mph wind in Class F atmospheric stability.

This release would impact the rural area around Delta Pride within a 1.8 mile radius and affect 2,900 residents, an industrial park and commercial area, Gentry High School, the Sunflower County, MS jail and 2 cemeteries.

Alternate Case
Chemical and Amount Released:8,000 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia in 60 minutes inside the Ammonia  Room.
Weather Conditions:77 ?F with a 6.7 mph wind in Class D atmospheric stability.

This release would affect a 0.2 mile radius from the center of the facility and have no offsite impact around Delta Pride; it would affect the 580 full-time employees at the facility.

Delta Pride is in compliance with OSHA PSM and emergency action plan regulations, as well as the EPCRA Section 302 rules.  The regularly scheduled maintenance program is key to maintaining the Delta Pride Refrigeration System in good operation.

There have been seven ammonia releases at Delta Pride during the last five years. These releases have been reported to the state Emergency Management Agency, but did not result in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage. Therefore, these releases are not reportable as defined in 40 CFR 68.42(a). Delta Pride has used each release to improve their ammonia handling and training at the facility. 

The equipment listed below is inspected daily.

?all refrigeration compressors
?all ammonia pumps
?all condensers
?all ice houses
?all heat exchangers
?all spiral freezers

Should there be an ammonia release that requires assist

ance, the Indianola, Mississippi Fire Department (IFD) will respond. The IFD has several trained Hazardous Material (HAZMAT) technicians that can handle any accidental ammonia release.  The IFD provides emergency response training to designated Delta Pride Emergency Response Team personnel.  Should the need for an evacuation occur, the Indianola Police Department (IPD) will notify all households identified by the IFD to be within a 1.8 mile radius downwind of the plant.
